title: Pau Alabajos
text:
Pau Alabajos i Ferrer (born 1982 in <a href="Torrent%2C%20Valencia">Torrent</a>, <a href="Horta%20Oest">Horta Oest</a>) is a <a href="Spain">spanish</a> singer-songwriter and politician. As of 2017 he has seven records under his belt. He is the current Secretary of the musicians and singers association in the <a href="Valencian%20Country">Valencian Country</a> "Col•lectiu Ovidi Montllor" (COM).
Since the 2015 local election he represents <a href="Comprom%C3%ADs">Compromís</a> in the City Council of <a href="Torrent%2C%20Valencia">Torrent</a>. The coalition holds a total of four seats.
Career.
Alabajos began his career performing on the streets of <a href="Valencia">Valencia</a>. His first record, "Futur en venda" (Future for Sale), was released in 2004. It included the song "Cançó Explícita" (Explicit Song) which won an award for its <a href="lyrics">lyrics</a> in 2006.
In 2008, his second album, "Teoria del caos" (Theory of chaos), was released.
In 2011, his third album, "Una amable, una trista, una petita pàtria" (a kind, sad, little homeland) was released.
Alabajos performed across Europe, the United States and other countries.
In September 2012, he celebrated ten years on stage with a concert at the <a href="Palau%20de%20la%20M%C3%BAsica%20de%20Val%C3%A8ncia">Palau de la Música de València</a>. He performed with an orchestra, artists and intellectuals from the <a href="Catalan%20Countries">Catalan Countries</a>.
He released a live album in 2014: #PaualPalau.
In 2013, he presented a book/musical record called "Pau Alabajos diu Mural del País Valencià de Vicent Andrés Estellés" based on poems by the <a href="Valencian">Valencian</a> <a href="National%20poet">National poet</a> from <a href="Burjassot">Burjassot</a>.
One of the songs Alabajos created, based on a poem by <a href="Salvador%20Espriu">Salvador Espriu</a>, was chosen for the album launched in 2013 "Amb música ho escoltaries potser millor" ("With music you might listen to it better").
In 2016, he released "L'amor i la ferocitat" ("Love and ferocity"), recorded and produced in <a href="Nashville">Nashville</a> (<a href="Tennessee">Tennessee</a>).
Politics.
Alabajos is the Secretary of the "Col•lectiu Ovidi Montllor", an association of <a href="Valencian">Valencian</a> singers and musicians. He is a <a href="local%20councillor">local councillor</a> in Torrent for <a href="Comprom%C3%ADs">Compromís</a> and an activist who supports <a href="Catalan%20independence">independence for the Catalan Countries</a> and <a href="State%20of%20Palestine">Palestine</a>.
He took part in debates covering current affairs and wrote pieces for newspapers and magazines such as ', ', "", "<a href="El%20Temps">El Temps</a>", "<a href="Levante-EMV">Levante-EMV</a>", "<a href="El%20Pa%C3%ADs">El País</a>", and "<a href="VilaWeb">VilaWeb</a>"). Alabajos has a degree in <a href="Catalan%20language">Catalan</a> <a href="Philology">Philology</a>.
